featureDescription.name: date
featureDescription.description: The date of running a GNfinder query.

featureDescription.name: language
featureDescription.description: Indicates the language that was used for calculation of Bayes' odds.

typeDescription.name: org.texttechnologylab.annotation.biofid.gnfinder.Taxon
typeDescription.description: Type for gnfinder-recognized taxonomic names that have not been verified.

featureDescription.name: cardinality
featureDescription.description: Cardinality depicts the number of elements in a name. 0 - Could not determine cardinality, 1 - Uninomial, 2 - Binomial, 3 - Trinomial.

featureDescription.name: oddsLog10
featureDescription.description: Log10 of the odds (probability) that name detection was correct.

featureDescription.name: oddsDetails
featureDescription.description: A list of OddsDetails that describe how odds were calculated (optional).

typeDescription.name: org.texttechnologylab.annotation.biofid.gnfinder.VerifiedTaxon
typeDescription.description: Type for verified gnfinder-recognized taxonomic names.

featureDescription.name: recordId
featureDescription.description: RecordID from a data source. GNFinder tries its to return ID that corresponds to dwc:taxonID of a DataSource. If such ID is not provided, this ID will be auto-generated. Auto-generated IDs will have 'gn_' prefix.

featureDescription.name: globalId
featureDescription.description: GlobalID that is exposed globally by a DataSource. Such IDs are usually self-resolved, like for example LSID, pURL, DOI etc.

featureDescription.name: localId
featureDescription.description: LocalID used by a DataSource internally. If an OutLink field is provided, LocalID serves as a 'dynamic' component of the URL.

featureDescription.name: outlink
featureDescription.description: Outlink to the record in the DataSource. It consists of a 'stable' URL and an appended 'dynamic' LocalID

featureDescription.name: sortScore
featureDescription.description:
SortScore is a numeric representation of the whole score. It can be used to find the BestMatch overall, as well as the best match for every data-source.
SortScore takes data from all other scores, using the priority sequence from highest to lowest: InfraSpecificRankScore, FuzzyLessScore, CuratedDataScore, AuthorMatchScore, AcceptedNameScore, ParsingQualityScore. Every highest priority trumps everything below. When the final score value is calculated, it is used to sort verification or search results.
Comparing this score between results of different verifications will not necessarily be accurate. The score is used for comparison of names from the same result.

featureDescription.name: matchedName
featureDescription.description: The name-string from the DataSource that was matched by GNames algorithm. Often contains the author names.

featureDescription.name: matchedCanonicalSimple
featureDescription.description: A simplified canonical form without ranks for names lower than species, and with omitted hybrid signs for named hybrids. Quite often simple canonical is the same as full canonical. Hybrid signs are preserved for hybrid formulas.

featureDescription.name: matchedCanonicalFull
featureDescription.description: A canonical form of the name that preserves hybrid signs and infraspecific ranks.

featureDescription.name: taxonomicStatus
featureDescription.description: Provides taxonomic status of a name. Can be "Accepted", "Synonym", "N/A".

featureDescription.name: currentName
featureDescription.description: The currently accepted name, present if it differs from the matchedName.

featureDescription.name: editDistance
featureDescription.description: The Levenshtein edit distance between canonical form of the input name-string and the matched canonical form. If match type is EXACT, edit-distance will be 0.

value.description: PartialExact used if GNames failed to match full name string. Now the match happened by removing either middle species epithets, or by choppping the 'tail' words of the input name-string canonical form.
PartialFuzzy is the same as PartialExact, but also the match was not exact. gnfinder never does fuzzy matches for uninomials, due to high rate of false positives.
PartialFuzzyRelaxed is the same as PartialFuzzy, but the fuzzy match rules were relaxed. This brings more false positives, but also more matches.

Fuzzy means that matches were not exact due to similarity of name-strings, OCR or typing errors. Take these results with more suspition than Exact matches. Fuzzy match is never done on uninomials due to the high rate of false positives.
FuzzyRelaxed is the same as Fuzzy, but the fuzzy match rules were relaxed. This brings more false positives, but also more matches.
FuzzySpeciesGroup means that match happened not with the name, but with either an autonym (botany)/coordinated name (zoology) of species, or binomial part of a trinomial.
FuzzySpeciesGroupRelaxed is the same as FuzzySpeciesGroup, but the fuzzy match rules were relaxed. This brings more false positives, but also more matches.
Exact means either canonical form, or the whole name-string matched perfectly.
ExactSpeciesGroup means that match happened not with the name, but with either an autonym (botany)/coordinated name (zoology) of species, or binomial part of a trinomial.
Virus names are matched in the database. `Virus` is a wide term and includes a variety of non-cellular terms (virus, prion, plasmid, vector etc.)
FacetedSearch is a match made by search procedure. It does not happen during verification.
